title: Marathon at Tokyo Olympics moved 500 MILES AWAY as organisers fear repeat of World Champs farce
text:
The marathon and race walking events at next year's Olympics have been relocated 500 miles north of Tokyo over fears about the brutal heat in the Japanese capital.

Tokyo 2020 organisers have been forced to act in the face of serious warnings over the risk to the athletes in summer temperatures that regularly exceed 35 degrees and 80 per cent humidity.

The marathon, which will be contested by Sir Mo Farah, and the walks will now move to Sapporo on Japan's northernmost island, Hokkaido, where it is estimated to be five to six degrees centigrade cooler during the day than Tokyo.

Sweltering conditions at the World Champs forced 28 women to withdraw from the marathon

China's Yugui Ma pouring water over herself during the World Championships in Doha, Qatar

Sapporo which has hosted Rugby World Cup games will now host the marathon and race walks

The switch follows the farce of the outdoor events at the athletics World Championships in Doha. In the women's marathon, 28 of the 68 starters withdrew, despite it starting at midnight.

'Athletes' health and well-being are always at the heart of our concerns,' IOC President Thomas Bach said on Wednesday.

'The new far-reaching proposals to move the marathon and race walking events show how seriously we take such concerns.

IOC President Bach (L) seen here with Japan Olympic Committee President Tsunekazu Takeda

British race walker Tom Bosworth sits in a wheelchair after finishing the 20km walk in Doha

'The Olympic Games are the platform where athletes can give 'once-in-a-lifetime' performances, and these measures ensure they have the conditions to give their best.'

Britain's leading race walker Tom Bosworth tweeted: 'Great to see the athletes/officials/spectators are more of a priority in Tokyo over Doha, but slightly disappointed to see it moved so far from the actual Olympics.

Correctly prepared athletes and races staged early/late in the day then this precaution is unnecessary.'
description: Tokyo 2020 organisers have been forced to act in the face of serious warnings over the risk to the athletes in summer temperatures that regular exceed 35 degrees and 80 per cent humidity.
